Andrew,

"Andrew Wilkie" <andrew.wilkie@...> writes:

> All the articles I read say to replace any System.out.println()
> calls with test cases. I am unable to get this to work when the
> System.out.println() is contained within the Catch statement of a
> Try/Catch block.

I wouldn't swallow that advice whole if I were you. As someone else
said, only particular kinds of prints can (or should) be replaced with
unit tests.

Moreover, I'm not sure that in this case it's appropriate to be unit
testing at all. Not being able to load the driver would indicate some
sort of deployment/setup problem, rather than an error in your
code. If anything, you should be (re-)throwing the exception here, and
your unit test should verify that the correct exception is thrown when
the driver isn't present.

Regards,
        JLM
